Message.Title: Ann Gets It
Message.Msg: There is an academic, peer-reviewed, long-term study of the effect of various public policies on public, multiple shootings in all 50 states over a 20-year period performed by renowned economists at the University of Chicago and Yale, William Landes and John Lott. It concluded that the only policy to reduce the incidence of, and casualties from, mass shootings are concealed-carry laws. The Times will never mention this study.

I just put a Burris Fastfire II reflex sight on my concealed carry weapon to increase my accuracy at intermediate to long ranges. Coupled with the FN FiveseveN it gives me an effective (50%) 300 meter range and a 100 meter primary (90%+) range on a standard silhouette (once I sight it in). Until then I'm on backup iron sights, which are good to, oh, maybe 20 yards, tops.
Is that model factory chrome tips on dual exhaust?
